721375f-a.text:
Madison Ave., east side, north from and including East 52nd Street. The 2-story building on the N.E. corner of East 52nd Street, is the Walker-Gordon Laboratory with the Juillard Music Foundation Building adjoining it on the east.
April 9, 1928.
0. L. Sperr.  Aecg at h SS

713599f-a.text:
57-89 East 52nd Street, north side, from east of Madison to Park Aves. The large building in the background is the
Racquet and Tennis Club.
August 15, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

1507501-a.title: Madison Avenue - 52nd Street #28-36, southeast corner
1507501-a.folder: Madison Avenue - 52nd Street #28-36, southeast corner, Manhattan, NY

721378f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, S.W. corner of 53rd Street, from clearing at N.E. corner of 52nd Street. This clearing was left by demolition of the Walker-Gordon Laboratory, and will be occupied by a new
30-story building.
Auguust 15, 1929.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.

721382f-b.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, north from 53rd to 5tth Streets, seen from the N.E. corner of 52nd Street. In the center background the new Hotel Savoy-Plaza at the S.E. corner of Fifth avenue almost completely hides the new Sherry Netherland on the N.E. corner.
August 15, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
The same, as seen from building at the S.E. corner of East 52nd Street, showing a more inclusive view farther north. The prominent buildings shown
are in the mid-town Fifth Ave..sone.
March 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721382f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, north from 53rd to 5tth Streets, seen from the N.E. corner of 52nd Street. In the center background the new Hotel Savoy-Plaza at the S.E. corner of Fifth avenue almost completely hides the new Sherry Netherland on the N.E. corner.
August 15, 1929.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
The same, as seen from building at the S.E. corner of East 52nd Street, showing a more inclusive view farther north. The prominent buildings shown
are in the mid-town Fifth Ave..sone.
March 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
